chapter.title: Ardour Live Tools
chapter.para: These are some notes on how to modify and improve Ardour use as a live performance tool.

section.title: Recording
section.para: What if any changes to recording would make Ardour better in as a live performance tool.
Does manipulation of track controls like record, solo, mute etc need to be able to be automated to occur at bar/beat boundaries or perhaps queue until locate occurs etc

section.title: Editing
section.para: What if any changes to editing would make Ardour better in as a live performance tool.
Muting regions using the mouse using Mute Tool
Tools for manipulation of automation data at snap intervals for cutter/gapper type effects.
Create range selection and add automation points at snap-to setting?

section.title: Looping
section.para: An important part of live performance is being able to easily manipulate loop points.
Be able to audition while transport is rolling to control outs/headphones. Also being able to audition in sync.

section.title: Controllers
section.para: Controllers play an integral part of live performance, so it will be necessary to have a fast and discoverable way to bind controllers to controls. This will be used for things like triggering changes in loop points. The location window might be a good place to allow binding controls for loop ranges.
Add support for a specific external controller such as an android or iOS application?

section.title: Effects
section.para: Being able to bind controllers to effect parameters is important.
